thread.title: Florida Supreme Court: Judge was wrong to ban abortions at Planned Parenthood in Kissimmee
thread.title_full: Florida Supreme Court: Judge was wrong to ban abortions at Planned Parenthood in Kissimmee

author: Rene Stutzman
title: Florida Supreme Court: Judge was wrong to ban abortions at Planned Parenthood in Kissimmee
text:
Rene Stutzman clinic in Kissimmee.
The dispute is over property restrictions. 
The owner of the medical plaza where the clinic opened filed suit against the non-profit, asking for a temporary injunction on abortions. 
MMB Properties alleged that outpatient surgical procedures were banned in the office complex by a set of property restrictions established in the 1980s. 
An Orange-Osceola trial judge ruled in favor of MMB and issued the ban, and when Planned Parenthood appealed, the Fifth District Court of Appeal in Daytona Beach initially ruled in the non-profit’s favor but when the full appeals court weighed in, sided with MMB. 
Even so, the Daytona appeals court ruled that the clinic could perform abortions while the legal dispute continued. 
Planned Parenthood then appealed to the Florida Supreme Court. 
The high court today ruled 4-to-2 in favor of Planned Parenthood in an opinion written by Justice Barbara Pariente. 
The court’s newest justice, C. Alan Lawson, who was just promoted from the Fifth District Court of Appeal, abstained. 
In today’s opinion, Pariente wrote that the trial judge’s opinion “sometimes completely misstates facts” and relied on facts not supported by evidence. 
Check back for updates.

An armed man barricaded himself in a home on Soria Avenue after an argument with his girlfriend, leading to an hours-long standoff with police. No one else is in the home.
